Body:
At least in the case of former US Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice, According the the New York Times:

[S]he was named after the musical terms 'con dolce' and 'con dolcezza,” meaning “with sweetness.”

I was unable to find a primary source (an interview or official biography, etc.) to confirm this explanation however the New York Times is a very reputable paper so I'm inclined to believe it.

LastEditedUser.AboutMe: I am currently studying for an MA in Computational Linguistics even though my background is not in linguistics. I discovered Computational Linguistics while receiving my B.A.Sc in Software Engineering when I built a basic bigram parser for an AI assignment. This caused me to become interested in linguistics and to take a few introductory level courses. I currently have completed my first year of my masters and am currently looking for a thesis topic.
